ai.summary: A short, easy coastal walk of about 2.2 km from Jarlshof to Sumburgh Head, offering sea views, grassy cliff-top paths, and opportunities to spot seabirds from a safe distance.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly cliff-top coastal path with grassy verges and some rocky or uneven sections. Expect exposed wind, possible damp ground, and occasional steps. The route runs close to the shoreline but stays on marked paths.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and keep away from cliff edges; winds can be strong and unpredictable near the headland. Check local weather and sea conditions before setting out; avoid walking in wet or icy conditions. If birds are nesting, respect restricted areas and keep dogs under control. Carry water, layer clothing, and have a means to call for help in remote areas.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly May to September) when daylight is longer and conditions are drier; seabird activity is high in late spring and summer.

seo.title: Jarlshof to Sumburgh Head Walk – Easy 2.2 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan a short, easy 2.2 km coastal hike from Jarlshof to Sumburgh Head in the UK. Find terrain details, safety tips, gear suggestions, and the best seasons for this scenic walk.
